data.text: @Snakeeater36 My issue is 1) they didn’t tell their story almost 2 years ago when this happened (bad news always comes out, and never gets better with age), and 2) when confronted, they deleted comments and blocked people who posted about a TRUE story (yes, missing facts, but true story).

@Aramnd76 @Stringfellow267 @jonnyklemchuk @Snakeeater36 Do you think email admins spend their day looking at people's emails? Speaking from experience, they've got better things to do than snoop on you.

@Kiss_Toms_Ass @Snakeeater36 @GSWIndiana @TheDutchPig @ClaudesBBQ Local news story then. Local response.
Why did it become a more wide spread story last week?
@Kiss_Toms_Ass @Snakeeater36 @TheDutchPig @ClaudesBBQ It’s already old news.   And when when dealing with hr personnel actions it’s tricky so you don’t get sued
@Aramnd76 @jonnyklemchuk @Snakeeater36 That made even less sense than your first one.

@Stringfellow267 @jonnyklemchuk @Snakeeater36 a work email is accessible to anyone administrating the server. I never used my military email and corporate one for personal use when I had them for such a reason.

if that company did then they had a crappy admin.

@TexasConsBanker @Snakeeater36 That's assuming the old employee would have known that this would come to light a year or so later.

I have doubts.

@Snakeeater36 @GSWIndiana @TheDutchPig @ClaudesBBQ the facility that was reported, apologized for their employee's actions. Just saying that a little more transparency back then might have saved most of the headache they're experiencing today. Would be old news by now.
